definition: dialectal accent

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
surname Fang
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: The compartment regulars between dialect and Mandrain are the important basis of dialect correctness.
sentences.chinese: 方言与普通话语音对应规律是方音辨正的重要依据。

sentences.english: Mutual explanation and dialects are the causes for the variant characters and pronunciations of this word.
sentences.chinese: 造成这种一词多形多音的原因是“转注”和方音。

sentences.english: In the last part, it explores the internal diversity of Jia County's dialect.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分，分析佳县方音的内部差异。

definition: the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
topolect/dialect
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
phonetic value of a character
dialect/patois
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
Middle Chinese (linguistics)
pitch of tones
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
Old Chinese (linguistics)
phonetic change
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
lateral consonant (phonetics)
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
